p: Since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, hydroxychloroquine has gained popularity as a potential preventative approach and therapeutic option for COVID-19 pneumonia. Hydroxychloroquine has been shown to inhibit SARS-CoV-2 replication in vitro [ 5â€“ 7]. The antiviral activity of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine stems from their ability to inhibit fusion of the virus with cell membranes [ 8]. Other proposed mechanisms of protection include inhibition of nucleic acid replication and glycosylation of viral proteins [ 8]. The in vivo activity of hydroxychloroquine against SARS-CoV-2 is unclear.
